column1: '''''The History of The Lord of the Rings''''' is a set of four books by [[Christopher Tolkien]]
column2: also published in ''[[The History of Middle-earth]]''-series. It documents the writing of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.

column1: # '''''[[The Return of the Shadow]]''''' ([[1988]]) begins with the initial composition
column2: and goes through to the [[Khazad-dûm|Mines of Moria]].

column1: # '''''[[The Treason of Isengard]]''''' ([[1989]]) continues to the meeting with [[Théoden]].
# '''''[[The War of the Ring]]''''' ([[1990]]) continues to the opening of the [[Morannon|Black Gate]].
# '''''[[The End of the Third Age]]''''' ([[1992]]) finishes the story. This is significantly shorter than its ''The History of Middle-earth'' counterpart
column3: as it omits ''[[The Notion Club Papers]]'' and ''[[The Drowning of Anadûnê]]''.

column2: the books are organized as chapters corresponding to the chapters in the final ''The Lord of the Rings''
column3: with additional chapters describing the "First Map"
column5: and other matters.  Each chapter begins with some context
column6: then the text of a first or second draft
column7: possibly some alternate drafts if there were especially large changes
column8: and interspersed with extended discussion of confusing  or contradictory situations.  The end of each chapter includes a set of notes about points of interest
column9: such as words that were used originally and then partially erased or struck out.
